Sentence: When he (Warden) was a boy, Stanley's great-great-grandfather, Elya Yelnats, received a pig from Madame Zeroni, a gypsy, in exchange for a promise
Elya's promise was that after the pig grew strong he (Stanley) would carry Madame Zeroni, who only had one leg, up a mountain and sing her (boy) a song that she (boy) had taught him (Stanley)
Elya marries and has a child in America and always thinks about Madame Zeroni, who he (Stanley) believes has cursed him (Stanley) because of his (Stanley) failure to fulfill his (Stanley) promise
He (Stanley) knows that Madame Zeroni's son lives in America, but Elya never finds him (son)
